div.p: Since version 5.12.0, Apache ActiveMQ comes with the new tool that can be used to produce and consume messages from the broker.

Before running the examples you should try running a JMS broker on your machine. Follow the Installation instructions to use a binary distribution of ActiveMQ. To run the broker in a command shell, type:

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: From the command line you can run

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: If you have activemq-all jar available you can achieve the same with

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.script: java -jar activemq-all-5.x.x.jar producer java -jar activemq-all-5.x.x.jar consumer

div.p: If you run inside Karaf, you can run the commands as

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: For all options on the commands, run them with --help parameter. The up to date, options for producer and consumer can be found in the source.
Here are a couple of examples of more advanced features.
To send a text message with custom text use

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: To send byte message of custom length use

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: To send a text message with content obtained from an url

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default
brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default
brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: To use durable topic subscribers use

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: In older versions of ActiveMQ, the corresponding examples were located in examples/ or examples/openwire/swissarmy/ directories, where you can do the similar tasks with an ant script.

script.class: brush: java; gutter: false; theme: Default

div.p: In examples/ directory (depending on the version) you can find more examples of using the broker with variety of protocols (mqtt, amqp, ...) and clients (Java, Ruby, JavaScript, ...), so it's the good place to start learning. Also, examples/conf/ directory contains a lot of different configuration examples that you can use as a starting point for your deployment.
